summary.p:
A multi-text (possibly composite) manuscript, entitled Akattiyar Aintu ("Five [works] of Akattiyar"), containing 5 different works of Akattiyar and the following codicological units:
The Akasttiyar aruḷicceytap pūṟaṇa cūsttiram ("Treatise on the fullness graciously composed by Akasttiyar"). One folio (only recto) without foliation (U1). Possibly a prefatory part to the next unit (U2), by another hand.
The Akattiya makāmuṉi cuvāmiy aruḷiya pūraṇa cūṣttiram, on the title page enlisted as Pūraṇacūttiram ("Treatise on the fullness"). It appears to be a text on yogic and religious practices, as well as alchemical preparations, consisting of 215 enumerated verses (U2).
A blank folio (U3).
The Akaṣttiya makāmuṉi aruḷicceyita tīṣṣai viti yirunūṟu, that is, Tīṣṣāviti ("Rules of initiation"). It appears to be a text on religious and alchemical practices, composed in 214 verses (U4)
The Akaṣttiyar ñāṉam ("Knowledge by Agastya"), which seems to be a text on religious and alchemical practices in 100 verses (U5).
The Akaṣttiyat vātacūṣttiram 200, "Alchemical treatise" (vātacūttiram), which appears to be a text on alchemy and medicine in 202 verses (U6).
An incomplete Pūcāviti ("Rules of worship"), which appears to be a text on yoga and religious practices in 201 verses. The beginning of the text is missing; thetext in the manuscript starts with verse 138. (U7).
